page.title: 02RAF LYNEHAM HISTORY
page.content: ROYAL AIR FORCE LYNEHAM WAS OPENED ON 13 FEBRUARY 1942 AS A SUPPLY UNIT PRIOR TO BECOMING A FLYING TRAINING STATION. ITS ROLE CHANGED TO THAT OF PREPARING AND DESPATCHING AIRCRAFT ALL OVER THE WORLD AS WELL AS THE TRAINING OF CREWS TO CARRY OUT THIS COMMITMENT. FROM MARCH 1943 UNTIL THE END OF WORLD WAR II LYNEHAM WAS THE MAIN AIR TERMINAL FOR BOAC. DURING THE POST-WAR YEARS LYNEHAM BECAME THE TERMINAL FOR LONG-RANGE TROOPING FLIGHTS FOR SERVICEMEN AND THEIR FAMILIES WITH HASTINGS AND BRITANNIA AIRCRAFT; COMET AIRCRAFT ALSO OPERATED FROM LYNEHAM UNTIL 1975 FOR VIP'S. IN 1968 THE STATION BEGAN ITS LONG ASSOCIATION WITH THE LOCKHEED C-130 HERCULES AND IS NOW THE BASE FOR THE TACTICAL ELEMENT OF THE R.A.F. TRANSPORT FORCE WITH 61 HERCULES BEING OPERATED BY 4 SQUADRONS.
